meanings.definition: A person or thing that evokes or brings forth a particular feeling or memory.
meanings.sent1: The movie was an evoker of nostalgia for the good old days.
meanings.sent2: The painting was a powerful evoker of emotions in the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The music box was a magical evoker of childhood memories.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh flowers was an evoker of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was a vivid evoker of past adventures.

meanings.definition: A spell or incantation used to summon or call forth a spirit or deity.
meanings.sent1: The wizard chanted the evoker to bring forth the ancient spirit.
meanings.sent2: The witch used an evoker to summon the mystical creature.
meanings.sent3: The magical book contained an evoker to call upon the forest guardian.
meanings.sent4: The enchanted amulet acted as an evoker to awaken the sleeping deity.
meanings.sent5: The sacred ritual included an evoker to invite the divine presence.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to bring about a specific response or reaction.
meanings.sent1: The alarm clock served as an evoker to wake up the heavy sleeper.
meanings.sent2: The bell was an evoker that signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The doorbell was an unexpected evoker of excitement for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The trigger on the gun acted as an evoker of fear in the room.
meanings.sent5: The red button was a powerful evoker that activated the emergency lights.
